      • readTerritoriesData

        public static Pair<java.util.List<java.lang.String>,java.lang.Integer> readTerritoriesData(java.lang.String filePath,
                                                                                           java.lang.String fileName,
                                                                                           java.lang.String fileExtension)

        Return the pair of the list of all territory name the game has just read, and the indicate number

        if the indicate number is 1 means there are duplications in the data, if it's 0 means there is no duplication

        Parameters:
        filePath - The path to the territories data folder
        fileName - The of the territory data file
        fileExtension - The extension of the territory data file
        Returns:
        The pair of the list of all territory name the game has just read, and the indicate number

        finalTerritories - The list contains all the territories supported in the game
        players - The list contains all player
        player - The player the game need to ask for input
        mapPath - The path to the map image
        userInput - The object to retrieve the user input
        Returns:
        The pair of string territory name and int territory index

      • battleStage

        public static void battleStage(java.util.List<Territory> finalTerritories,
                               java.util.List<Player> players,
                               java.lang.String mapPath,
                               java.util.Scanner userInput)

        Set up everything to prepare battles

        Users will be ask to choose a territory to attack from and a territory they want to attack

        Parameters:
        finalTerritories - The list of all supported territories
        players - The list of all players
        mapPath - The path to the map image
        userInput - User input variable

      • play

        public static int play(Player attacker,
                       Territory attackerTerritory,
                       Player defender,
                       Territory defenderTerritory,
                       java.util.Scanner userInput)

        Each player involves in the battle will choose number of dice they want to roll depends on how many troops they have on their territories which involved in the battle

        Parameters:
        attacker - The player who is going to attack
        attackerTerritory - The territory the attacker is going to attack from
        defender - The player who is going to have to defend
        defenderTerritory - The territory the attack is going to attack, also the territory the defender has to defend
        userInput - User input variable
        Returns:

      • checkWinCondition

        public static boolean checkWinCondition(java.util.List<Player> players)

        Check whether we have the final winner of the game

        Parameters:
        players - The list contains all player
        Returns:
        The result of the battle:

        result = -2 means there are error(s) when execute battle function

        result = -1 means the attacker loses, and the defender wins

        result = 0 means neither the attacker nor the defender win

        result = 1 means the attacker wins, and the defender loses

      • printTerritory

        public static boolean printTerritory(java.lang.String territoryName,
                                     java.util.List<Territory> territories)

        Print basic information of territory base on territoryName and all its adjacent territories

        Parameters:
        territoryName - .Territory name which the information is pulled from
        territories - .Territory list
        Returns:
        True when territoryName is valid territory, and False when territoryName is not found

      • printTerritory

        public static boolean printTerritory(int territoryIndex,
                                     java.util.List<Territory> territories)

        Print basic information of territory base on territoryIndex and all its adjacent territories

        Parameters:
        territoryIndex - .Territory index which corresponding to the order the territory names are appeared in the console window and from that we can pull the information of the territory
        territories - The territory list
        Returns:
        True when territoryName is valid territory, and False when territoryName is not found
